results.title: What is Apple? An products and history overview
results.content: # Apple. ## What is Apple? (formerly Apple Computer Inc.) is an American computer and consumer electronics company famous for creating the iPhone, iPad and Macintosh computers. ## Apple product lines. Apple offers numerous products and services. **Mac computer****.** The Macintosh, or Mac, is Apple's line of personal computers. Apple Intelligence will be integrated into iOS 18 and supported on devices such as iPhone 15 Pro and newer; iPad Air models with M1 or newer chips; and Mac models with M1 or newer chips. Desperate to return to profitability and find a new operating system for its computers, Apple purchased Steve Jobs' new company, NeXT in early 1997. Apple also introduced video editing and CD/DVD mastering software, cementing Macintosh's role in digital media production. Apple has continued to release new products and expanded services in recent years. Apple has switched to using its own in-house designed CPUs, first in iPhone and now in its Macintosh line of computers.

results.title: Apple Inc. | History, Products, Headquarters, & Facts
results.content: **Apple Inc.** is an American multinational technology company that revolutionized the technology sector through its innovation of computer software, personal computers, mobile tablets, smartphones, and computer peripherals. Founded by Steve Jobs and Steve Wozniak in 1976, Apple set new benchmarks in product innovation, user-centric functionality, aesthetics and design, and multiproduct integration. In addition to signing a technology agreement with Motorola, Inc. to develop a next-generation chip, known as the PowerPC, Apple and IBM created two new software companies to develop operating system software: Taligent, Inc., and Kaleida Labs, Inc. By June 19, 2009, when Apple released the iPhone 3GS (which sold one million units in the first three days), the company’s share of the smartphone market had reached about 20% (compared with about 55% for the BlackBerry line of smartphones).
